id_card.description: All students must carry and wear their ID card at all times on campus.
key_points: ID card must be worn at all times inside college premises.
Entry into college is strictly based on possession of a valid ID card.

dress_code.description: Students must wear semi-formals. Inappropriate dressing may result in penalties.
key_points: T-shirts with objectionable pictures or statements are not allowed.
Girls must wear skirts or pants of at least knee length. Short skirts and shorts are not allowed.
Boys are not permitted to wear shorts or three-fourths inside campus.
Hair must be neatly tied back during lab, workshop, and machine shop practicals.
Closed shoes are mandatory in workshop, machine shop, and all mechanical engineering labs.
Formals are required for oral exams, presentations, interviews, placement activities, and technical sessions.

campus_behaviour.description: Students must maintain discipline and decorum on campus at all times.
key_points: Eatables are not permitted in classrooms, library, or computer centre.
Smoking, alcohol, and drug consumption are strictly prohibited. Violation may lead to rustication.
The college is a strict No Ragging campus.
Gambling and playing cards on campus is not allowed.
Any damage to college property must be compensated by the student.
Behavior that brings disrepute to the institution inside or outside campus will result in disciplinary action.
The institute is not responsible for police or regulatory action taken against students for misdemeanors.
Eve teasing and objectionable personal comments will be dealt with seriously. Legal action may be taken.
Public display of affection in any form is strictly prohibited.
Mobile phones are strictly prohibited in classrooms, library, labs, workshops, computer rooms, and examination halls.
Stealing, fighting, and misbehaviour with faculty will be dealt with very seriously.
Possession of firearms, knives, or other sharp objects is strictly prohibited and may result in legal action.
Changing or modifying personal information in digital form is a serious offense and may result in rustication.
Any student found indulging in substance abuse will be dealt with seriously.

classroom_attendance.description: Students must maintain at least 75% attendance in each subject as per university norms.
key_points: Minimum attendance requirement is 75% per subject.
Failure to meet attendance norms will result in the term not being granted and ineligibility to appear for the semester exam.
Students must monitor their own attendance; no separate notice will be displayed.
No student may leave the classroom during a class without the teacher's permission.

late_coming.description: Students are expected to arrive at least 5 minutes before the class starts.
key_points: Faculty will not permit latecomers into the class.
Late students will be marked partially absent for that class.

leave.description: Leave of more than 3 days must be supported with proper documents.
key_points: Medical, personal, or official leave of more than 3 days requires supporting documents.
Leave consideration is as per University norms.
Special leave may be granted for students representing DBIT or the University in extra-curricular activities.
Prior written intimation is required for leave of absence.
All leave must be sanctioned by the Head of the Department.
Students must complete all assignments, projects, or term work missed during leave.

laboratories_and_workshop.description: Students must strictly follow safety norms in all labs and workshops.
key_points: Safety norms prescribed for each lab/workshop must be strictly followed.
Indiscipline in labs or workshops will be handled by the concerned faculty.
Cost of any damage caused to lab/workshop equipment will be recovered from the student.
A written record must be maintained in the maintenance register for any damage.

tutorials_and_assignments.description: All tutorial and assignment work must be completed and submitted during the respective class.
key_points: Tutorial/assignment work must be completed during the tutorial class and submitted to the concerned faculty.
Doing tutorial/assignment work during other lectures is not permitted.
Shortfall in tutorial/assignment work is not allowed for any reason.
Timely submission is mandatory; failure to submit may result in term work not being accepted.

internal_assessment.description: Class tests, viva-voce, seminars, and projects are all part of internal assessment.
key_points: Students must attend all class tests.
Retests are allowed only for absence due to illness or emergency with valid documents.
Short-term projects, seminars, and other activities are part of internal assessment and compulsory.
Use of unfair means during exams is not tolerated and will be dealt with as per University norms.
In the examination room, the invigilator is the sole authority for any queries or disputes.
It is the student's sole responsibility to hand over the answer booklet to the invigilator.
Absence in any exam is considered a backlog (AB grade).
Refer to the university examination guidelines for AB grade implications.
Only students with a valid ID card can access the library.
Bags, notebooks, laptops, and personal possessions cannot be carried inside the library.
Silence must be maintained. Mobile phones must be switched off or on silent mode.
Photography, filming, videotaping, or audio taping inside the library is not permitted.
Electronic resources of the library must be used strictly for DBIT purposes.
Unauthorized removal or damage of library material is a serious offense and may result in a fine or disciplinary action.
Fines are charged for overdue books as per the notice board guidelines.
Unpaid fines may result in suspension of borrowing rights and electronic access.
Reference books marked 'For Reference Only' cannot be issued.
Journals cannot be taken outside the library; only photocopies for personal use are allowed.
Loss or damage of books/periodicals will result in the student paying for or replacing the item.
Non-compliance may result in a warning or being debarred from the library for a specific period.
Computers are available in the library and in respective departments.
Misuse of computing facilities may result in withdrawal of computer access rights.
Computers can be accessed on all working days from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, but not at the cost of lectures, practicals, or tutorials.
Students may visit the canteen only during short breaks, long breaks, or after college hours.
Playground is available on weekdays: 8:00 AM–8:45 AM, 1:15 PM–2:00 PM, 5:00 PM–6:00 PM.
Use on holidays requires prior permission from the Administrator.
Using the playground during working hours disturbs classes and is not permitted; violators may be penalised.
No food items or beverages should be consumed on the playground.
Littering on the playground should be avoided.
DBIT organises a technical festival (COLOSSEUM) and a cultural festival (CREXTAL) every year.
Festival dates and participation details are displayed on main notice boards in advance.
Intra-collegiate sports are organised annually with details on the main notice board.
Two NSS units operate in the institute with 100 students.
Only SE, TE, and BE students can enrol for NSS activities.
Students who fulfil NSS service criteria receive 10 extra marks in the even semester from the university.
NSS camps are held annually for community interaction and service.
Students need prior written approval from the faculty-in-charge to participate in inter-collegiate events.
Written approval must be submitted to the class teacher or HOD before the event.
Students are responsible for making up any missed academic work; no concession is granted.
FE Semester I students generally cannot participate, except state-level athletes/players with prior written permission.
Students winning awards should inform the Faculty In-charge and submit proof; they will be felicitated.
Every department has a student chapter of a professional body (SAE, ISHRAE, IEEE, IETE, CSI, ACM, ISTE, etc.).
Industrial visits, technical competitions, and expert lectures are organised through these chapters.
Students can contact their HOD for membership and participation details.
Certification courses (JAVA, Oracle, Red Hat Linux, Android Programming, CFD, etc.) are offered in collaboration with certifying agencies.
Contact the HOD for details on fees, course duration, and enrolment.
The institute gives top priority to the safety and security of students, staff, and visitors.
A first-aid kit is available in the office for minor emergencies.
Water purifiers and water coolers are available on every floor.
Fire extinguishers and fire-fighting systems are installed in each building.
Wearing a helmet is compulsory for all two-wheeler riders entering and exiting campus. Non-compliance results in restricted entry or a penalty of Rs. 500.
Students can freely approach their teacher for guidance or help.
Counsellors are available on campus twice a week for emotional support.
Students can also meet the Campus Minister for help.
Teachers are available for career and professional guidance.
Aggrieved students should first submit a written petition to their Class Teacher, who will try to resolve it within 10 days.
If unsatisfied, the student can escalate to the HOD.
If still unresolved, the matter can be taken to the Principal through the HOD.
If not redressed, the grievance is forwarded to the Grievance Redressal Committee with written acknowledgment.
The committee will submit its recommendations and report within one month.
All discussions are minuted and kept confidential.
If dissatisfied with the committee's decision, the student may directly approach the Director/management.
The committee includes teaching and non-teaching staff, the Principal, and a management representative.
Members of the Women's Development Cell (WDC) are included for women's grievances.

womens_development_cell.description: The Women's Development Cell (WDC) at DBIT ensures a safe working and studying environment for all women.
womens_development_cell.members: All female students, faculty, and staff of DBIT.
objectives: Create an environment of gender justice with personal security and dignity for all.
Enhance self-esteem and self-confidence of girl students, women faculty, and staff.
Create awareness about problems faced by women due to gender issues, especially working women.
Promote a healthy study and work culture with a sense of responsibility.
Foster decision-making ability in girl students for informed choices in education, employment, and health.
Create awareness about issues related to youth and girls in particular.
Disseminate knowledge about rights and laws related to women.
Implement policies regarding sexual harassment at the workplace.
Train women students and staff in self-defence techniques.
